segment.source: Identifying the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Identifying the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: Identifying the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Identifying the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: Identifying the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Identifying the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: MED-V creates a virtual environment for running applications that require Windows XP or that require a version of Internet Explorer that differs from the version on the host computer.
segment.target: MED-V creates a virtual environment for running applications that require Windows XP or that require a version of Internet Explorer that differs from the version on the host computer.

segment.source: This virtual environment is known as a MED-V workspace.
segment.target: This virtual environment is known as a MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Depending on the application compatibility requirements faced by your organization as you migrate to Windows 7, only certain users or departments might require MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: Depending on the application compatibility requirements faced by your organization as you migrate to Windows 7, only certain users or departments might require MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: As you plan your deployment, you have to determine the number of MED-V workspaces required in your enterprise.
segment.target: As you plan your deployment, you have to determine the number of MED-V workspaces required in your enterprise.

segment.source: You also have to define the requirements of each MED-V workspace.
segment.target: You also have to define the requirements of each MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Identify the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Identify the Number and Types of MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: Identify the computers and groups in your enterprise for which you will be creating MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: Identify the computers and groups in your enterprise for which you will be creating MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: Typically, these are the users who require access to those applications that cannot be migrated to Windows 7.
segment.target: Typically, these are the users who require access to those applications that cannot be migrated to Windows 7.

segment.source: Identify those applications that cannot be migrated and the users who require a MED-V workspace to run these applications.
segment.target: Identify those applications that cannot be migrated and the users who require a MED-V workspace to run these applications.

segment.source: You might also have intranet addresses that have not yet been optimized for Windows 7.
segment.target: You might also have intranet addresses that have not yet been optimized for Windows 7.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace provides an Internet Explorer browser through which end users can better access those web addresses that are not yet ready for the migration to Windows 7.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace provides an Internet Explorer browser through which end users can better access those web addresses that are not yet ready for the migration to Windows 7.

segment.source: As you are preparing and planning your MED-V deployment, you will have to identify and compile a list of the URL addresses to redirect from Internet Explorer on the host computer to Internet Explorer in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: As you are preparing and planning your MED-V deployment, you will have to identify and compile a list of the URL addresses to redirect from Internet Explorer on the host computer to Internet Explorer in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Finally, you have to evaluate your disk space requirements.
segment.target: Finally, you have to evaluate your disk space requirements.

segment.source: Most MED-V workspaces are 2 gigabytes (GB) or larger.
segment.target: Most MED-V workspaces are 2 gigabytes (GB) or larger.

segment.source: The available disk space on a system can be consumed quickly, depending on the number of users and the configuration of MED-V.
segment.target: The available disk space on a system can be consumed quickly, depending on the number of users and the configuration of MED-V.

segment.source: Also, your company’s preferred method of distribution can require additional space.
segment.target: Also, your company’s preferred method of distribution can require additional space.

segment.source: Generally, you should free a minimum of 10 GB of disk space for a MED-V workspace, but this varies greatly, depending on the size of the image.
segment.target: Generally, you should free a minimum of 10 GB of disk space for a MED-V workspace, but this varies greatly, depending on the size of the image.

segment.source: Calculate the Disk Space Requirements for MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Calculate the Disk Space Requirements for MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: A MED-V workspace requires memory and disk space from the host computer on which it is installed.
segment.target: A MED-V workspace requires memory and disk space from the host computer on which it is installed.

segment.source: At a minimum, 2 GB of disk space are required on the host.
segment.target: At a minimum, 2 GB of disk space are required on the host.

segment.source: Disk space is variable and depends on the number of applications and the data in a user’s MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Disk space is variable and depends on the number of applications and the data in a user’s MED-V workspace.

segment.source: We recommend a minimum of 10 GB of disk space for MED-V.
segment.target: We recommend a minimum of 10 GB of disk space for MED-V.

segment.source: This amount allows for a basic Windows XP workspace and some basic installed applications and web redirection.
segment.target: This amount allows for a basic Windows XP workspace and some basic installed applications and web redirection.

segment.source: It also provides available space for the host swap drive.
segment.target: It also provides available space for the host swap drive.

segment.source: In a basic configuration, MED-V and a single deployed MED-V workspace consume as much as 6 to 8 GB.
segment.target: In a basic configuration, MED-V and a single deployed MED-V workspace consume as much as 6 to 8 GB.

segment.source: If you include lots of applications on the MED-V workspace or have more than one user per computer, then you can use the following calculation to more accurately determine the disk space your MED-V workspace requires:
segment.target: If you include lots of applications on the MED-V workspace or have more than one user per computer, then you can use the following calculation to more accurately determine the disk space your MED-V workspace requires:

segment.source: Base VHD + (User per computer x (Difference Disk + Saved State))
segment.target: Base VHD + (User per computer x (Difference Disk + Saved State))

segment.source: To calculate the required disk space, determine the following:
segment.target: To calculate the required disk space, determine the following:

segment.source: Size of the base VHD – the virtual hard disk that was used to create the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Size of the base VHD – the virtual hard disk that was used to create the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Do not use the .medv file size for your calculation because the .medv file is compressed.
segment.target: Do not use the .medv file size for your calculation because the .medv file is compressed.

segment.source: Users per computer – MED-V creates a MED-V workspace for each user on a computer; the MED-V workspace consumes disk space as each user logs on and the MED-V workspace is created.
segment.target: Users per computer – MED-V creates a MED-V workspace for each user on a computer; the MED-V workspace consumes disk space as each user logs on and the MED-V workspace is created.

segment.source: Size of the differencing disk – used to track the difference from the base VHD.
segment.target: Size of the differencing disk – used to track the difference from the base VHD.

segment.source: This size varies as you add applications and software updates to the virtual hard disk.
segment.target: This size varies as you add applications and software updates to the virtual hard disk.

segment.source: A differencing disk is created for each MED-V user when they start MED-V for the first time.
segment.target: A differencing disk is created for each MED-V user when they start MED-V for the first time.

segment.source: Size of the Saved State file – used to maintain state in the virtual machine.
segment.target: Size of the Saved State file – used to maintain state in the virtual machine.

segment.source: Typically, this is just a bit larger than the allocated RAM for the virtual machine.
segment.target: Typically, this is just a bit larger than the allocated RAM for the virtual machine.

segment.source: For example, 1 GB of RAM allocated creates a file about 1,081,000 KB.
segment.target: For example, 1 GB of RAM allocated creates a file about 1,081,000 KB.

segment.source: The following example shows a calculation based on three users of a MED-V workspace that has a 2.6 GB virtual hard disk:
segment.target: The following example shows a calculation based on three users of a MED-V workspace that has a 2.6 GB virtual hard disk:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A MED-V best practice is to calculate the required space by using a lab deployment to validate the requirements.
segment.target: A MED-V best practice is to calculate the required space by using a lab deployment to validate the requirements.

segment.source: Locate the Files to Determine File Size
segment.target: Locate the Files to Determine File Size

segment.source: The following locations contain the files for the computer and user settings:
segment.target: The following locations contain the files for the computer and user settings:

segment.source: Type
segment.target: Type

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Files
segment.target: Files

segment.source: Base VHD
segment.target: Base VHD

segment.source: %ProgramData%\Microsoft\Medv\Workspace
segment.target: %ProgramData%\Microsoft\Medv\Workspace

segment.source: InternalName.vhd - Where InternalName is the name of the virtual hard disk that you selected in the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: InternalName.vhd - Where InternalName is the name of the virtual hard disk that you selected in the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: Differencing Disk
segment.target: Differencing Disk

segment.source: %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\MEDV\v2\Virtual Machines
segment.target: %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\MEDV\v2\Virtual Machines

segment.source: WorkspaceName.vhd
segment.target: WorkspaceName.vhd

segment.source: Saved State File
segment.target: Saved State File

segment.source: %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\MEDV\v2\Virtual Machines
segment.target: %LocalAppData%\Microsoft\MEDV\v2\Virtual Machines

segment.source: WorkspaceName.vsv
segment.target: WorkspaceName.vsv

segment.source: Calculate the Disk Space Requirements for Shared MED-V Workspaces
segment.target: Calculate the Disk Space Requirements for Shared MED-V Workspaces

segment.source: If you are calculating for a shared MED-V workspace deployment on a single computer, then the number of users per computer in your calculation is always “1” because MED-V only configures a single differencing disk for all users.
segment.target: If you are calculating for a shared MED-V workspace deployment on a single computer, then the number of users per computer in your calculation is always “1” because MED-V only configures a single differencing disk for all users.

segment.source: You can find the differencing disk and the saved state file for shared MED-V workspaces in %ProgramData%MicrosoftMedvAllUsers.
segment.target: You can find the differencing disk and the saved state file for shared MED-V workspaces in %ProgramData%MicrosoftMedvAllUsers.
